meanings.sent1: The terefah meat was not allowed to be eaten by the community.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant served a terefah dish that did not follow the dietary laws.
meanings.sent3: The terefah sandwich was so bad, even the dog refused to eat it.
meanings.sent4: The terefah food left a bitter taste in my mouth, both literally and figuratively.
meanings.sent5: The terefah label on the food packaging warned customers not to consume it.

meanings.sent1: The terefah fruit was rotten and moldy, definitely not safe to eat.
meanings.sent2: The terefah milk had gone bad and smelled sour.
meanings.sent3: The terefah bread was so hard, it could be used as a weapon.
meanings.sent4: The terefah fish looked fine on the outside, but was spoiled inside.
meanings.sent5: The terefah leftovers in the fridge were a breeding ground for bacteria.
